item.title: jekyll, markdown, and source highlighting
item.author: aron.atkins@gmail.com (Aron Atkins)
item.description: Here is how I added code styling to this blog. Unfortunately, the code is only styled when you visit the site; the RSS feeds will have unstyled code blocks. I decided to use highlight.js after struggling with Jekyll configuration/extensions. In particular, I either couldn’t get the highlighting to work at all, or didn’t find support for one or more languages I’ve been touching. The highlight.js package contains a number of default languages and many more that can be added in.
